reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night on our way through Newport. The location is great - can walk to everything (shopping, bars, good restaurants). The place is older....If that is a turn off, stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Okay place - Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They said they served breakfast, but we got nothing......
reviews.title: Very cute and comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They comped our parking in lieu of the breakfast though.
reviews.title: Don't stay at America's Cup Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No overnight attendant - so we were virtually alone on our stay. Only guests in the hotel. Odd.
reviews.title: Dated but comfortable. Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Again, the location makes it great.....
reviews.title: An Overlooked Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the location. This inn is in the middle of everything. You can walk to restaurants and shops. The rooms were nothing fancy but clean and spacious. I would definitely reccomend this place. The price was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was super friendly, made us feel at home. Location was the best. Rooms were much larger than we expected and had a private bath (not always the case in a B & B). Bed was very comfortable and there was a mini fridge in the room. Cant wait to go back!
reviews.title: Chaming Inn in the heart of Newport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this Inn because of the location. Just a block to the piers.
reviews.title: It Could Be Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: When we booked we were told there was a parking lot across the street to make sure to take a ticket. We did, had it validated and still paid $18 a night.
reviews.title: Best Bet in Newport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air in the rooms is not controlled by the quest so I imagine there were some folks very uncomfortable including us.
reviews.title: I loved my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: You better not get sick or die...either way you will be paying their first nights cost which is easily over $300 even if you cancel 24 hour ahead of time. Although their policy states that you must cancel at least 5 or so days in advance, sometimes an illness or an accident is beyond our control and we may not be able to keep our reservations. I can understand having a $50 cancellation penalty, or maybe even $150 (which is a bit high) but a WHOPPING $335 is the penalty I had to pay when I unexpectedly became ill a day before my trip. I wasnt even given the option of sending a doctor's note! BEWARE!!!! THese folks are too desperate and are prepared to take your money.
reviews.title: You better not get sick or die

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went back to Newport for a long Halloween weekend and stayed once again at America's Cup Inn. It's my second stay and I am so happy that I returned. After I made my reservation online I called to confirm that it was received and I requested the same room I stayed in last year. Beverly was very helpful on the phone. We arrived late that night and the staff arranged that everything was ready for us. They gave us the same room as requested. The feeling at the Inn is like at home. The staff find a way to have very pleasant, nice people, haven't seeing any pets which I appreciate. Don't get me wrong I do like dogs but not in this type of Inn.
reviews.title: A Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Best breakfast selection you can get. The lady in charge of that area always had a smile in her face. Our room was always clean and organized for us even when we didn't request for the service.
reviews.title: Great location - the best find downtown Newport!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dimitry at the front desk always helpful and ready to answer any questions we had. Great host. I can't thank you all enough for making once again our stay at the Inn unforgettable. I was very sad I had to leave. Looking forward to go back next year.
reviews.title: Needs renovation-dark and musty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were looking for a deal in downtown area, and found this great place just walking by. Checked them on my phone, saw great reviews about them, booked a room directly on their site, which was a bargain. We were very pleased to get a double room on the second floor with a great view. Front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. Breakfast was outstanding! so much to chose from. We are coming back there in October for the fest!
reviews.title: Great local, rooms are just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Americas Cup Inn is centrally located in the heart of Newport, within walking distance of the harbor, all the city's restaurants, and even some of the mansions. Purely a bed and breakfast, the room we had on the second floor was cozy and comfortable. I was especially pleased to see that while it did not have a tv, it had a number of carefully chosen books. Parking is the major problem in Newport. The Inn has arrangements with the municipal parking lot across Mary Street (not Thames Street) to accommodate guests' cars at $18 for each 24 hour period, with unlimited exit and enter during that time. It worked out well, but must be considered when calculating your daily cost. All in all, an excellent choice if you want to be in the center of town.
reviews.title: Cozy and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great vacation. Demetri at the desk was wonderful. We were made to feel welcome and found our room to be cozy and clean. A slow-dripping leak under the sink was fixed the very same day we reported it! (Thanks!)
reviews.title: Comfortable room,convenient, quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We have no complaints at all about the room, the staff, or even anyone we met in Newport. It was an exciting place to visit. We shall be returning....someday.
reviews.title: Nice B&B in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. This was Easter week, early April, not the busy season, so it was a good time time to visit before the summer crowds change the atmosphere.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pat & Mike H.
reviews.title: Felt like home.
